name: Ports and Protocols
description: Learn how applications communicate over networks through ports and protocols. Understand TCP vs UDP, common port numbers, and how firewalls control traffic flow.

learning_steps.title: TCP and UDP Explained
learning_steps.description: Understand the difference between TCP (connection-oriented, reliable) and UDP (connectionless, fast). Know when to use each protocol.

learning_steps.title: TCP Three-Way Handshake
learning_steps.description: Understand SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK and how TCP connections are established. This knowledge is crucial for troubleshooting connection issues.

learning_steps.title: How Firewalls Work
learning_steps.description: Understand how firewalls filter traffic based on IP, port, and protocol. Learn about stateful vs stateless firewalls.

learning_steps.title: Cloud Security Groups
learning_steps.description: Preview how cloud providers implement firewalls as security groups. Understand inbound vs outbound rules and the concept of least privilege.

learning_steps.title: View Active Connections
learning_steps.description: Use netstat -tulpn or ss -tulpn to see what ports are listening on your system. Identify which processes are using which ports.

questions.prompt: Explain the difference between TCP and UDP, and give examples of when you would use each.
scenario_seeds: You're building a real-time game and need to decide between TCP and UDP for player position updates.
A video streaming service is experiencing buffering issues. Discuss whether the transport protocol choice matters.
Your chat application needs to ensure messages are never lost. Which protocol should you use and why?
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain TCP is connection-oriented with reliability guarantees AND UDP is connectionless with lower overhead AND provide appropriate use cases for each.

questions.prompt: A service you deployed isn't accessible. Walk me through how you would troubleshoot whether it's a firewall or port issue.
scenario_seeds: Your newly deployed API returns 'connection refused' when you curl it from another machine.
A database migration script can't connect to the production database, but works locally.
After a security update, your monitoring system can't reach the application servers.
questions.grading_rubric: Must check if service is listening on expected port AND verify firewall rules allow traffic AND test connectivity from client perspective.

test_knowledge_prompts: Quiz me on TCP vs UDP
Ask me about common port numbers
